events.originalText: The wedding of Prince Harry and Meghan Markle took place at St George's Chapel in Windsor Castle, England.
events.subtitle: Wedding of Prince Harry and Meghan Markle
events.headline: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle wed at St George's Chapel in Windsor Castle

events.originalText: A corroded pipeline near Refugio State Beach, California, spilled 142,800 gallons (3,400 barrels) of crude oil onto the Gaviota Coast.
events.subtitle: Refugio State Beach
events.headline: Corroded pipeline spills 142,800 gallons of crude oil near Refugio State Beach

events.originalText: In Bangkok, the Thai military (pictured) concluded a week-long crackdown on widespread protests by forcing the surrender of opposition leaders.
events.subtitle: Royal Thai Armed Forces
events.headline: Thai military crackdown on protests in Bangkok forces surrender of opposition leaders

events.originalText: The Sierra Gorda Biosphere, which encompasses the most ecologically diverse region in Mexico, was established as a result of grassroots efforts.
events.subtitle: Sierra Gorda
events.headline: Sierra Gorda Biosphere established in Mexico due to grassroots efforts

events.originalText: Breakup of Yugoslavia: With the local Serb population boycotting the referendum, Croatians voted in favour of independence from Yugoslavia.
events.subtitle: Breakup of Yugoslavia
events.headline: Croatians vote for independence from Yugoslavia as local Serbs boycott referendum

events.originalText: First World War: Australian and New Zealand troops repelled the third attack on Anzac Cove, inflicting heavy casualties on the attacking Ottoman forces.
events.subtitle: World War I
events.headline: Australian and New Zealand troops repel third attack on Anzac Cove

events.originalText: Parks Canada, the world's first national park service, was established as the Dominion Parks Branch under the Department of the Interior.
events.subtitle: Parks Canada
events.headline: Parks Canada established as world's first national park service

events.originalText: Captain John Franklin (pictured) departed Greenhithe, England, on an expedition to the Canadian Arctic in search of the Northwest Passage; all 129 men were later lost when their ships became icebound in Victoria Strait.
events.subtitle: John Franklin
events.headline: Captain John Franklin's expedition to Canadian Arctic ends in tragedy

events.originalText: The United States Congress passed the largest tariff in the nation's history, which resulted in severe economic hardship in the American South.
events.subtitle: United States Congress
events.headline: US Congress passes largest tariff in history, causing economic hardship in South

events.originalText: A combination of thick smoke, fog, and heavy cloud cover caused darkness to fall on parts of Canada and the New England area of the United States by noon.
events.subtitle: New England's Dark Day
events.headline: Darkness falls on parts of Canada and New England due to smoke, fog, and cloud cover

events.originalText: American Revolutionary War: A Continental Army garrison west of Montreal surrendered to British troops at the Battle of the Cedars.
events.subtitle: American Revolutionary War
events.headline: British troops capture Continental Army garrison at Battle of the Cedars

events.originalText: French physicist Jean-Pierre Christin published the design of a mercury thermometer using the centigrade scale, with 0 representing the melting point of water and 100 its boiling point.
events.subtitle: Jean-Pierre Christin
events.headline: Jean-Pierre Christin designs mercury thermometer using centigrade scale

events.originalText: Anglo-Spanish War: England invaded Spanish Jamaica, capturing it a week later.
events.subtitle: Anglo-Spanish War (1654–1660)
events.headline: England captures Spanish Jamaica during Anglo-Spanish War

events.originalText: Gregory II began his pontificate; his conflict with Byzantine emperor Leo III eventually led to the establishment of the temporal power of the pope.
events.subtitle: Pope Gregory II
events.headline: Gregory II begins pontificate, leading to conflict with Byzantine emperor Leo III
